tweets.text:
The @EnvAgency calculate that Affinity Water are over abstracting local chalk streams to the tune of about 430 million litres of water per day.

That's almost 10% of the world's total supply of chalk streams degraded for profit.

Let's talk about a clean conscience shall we. https://t.co/J8nQmVNWlv
@EnvAgencyMids @RedIndustries2 Go tell it to a town where everyone has no sense of smell, they might believe you. #StopTheStink

Neighbour in A and E last night reports landfill fumes filling the waiting rooms 
What will it take for you to step in and stop this @BorisJohnson @MPGeorgeEustice @MattHancock ? 
This is like living in a horror film @EnvAgency @PHE_EoEngland @DefraGovUK @ShaunLintern

tweets.text: Dr. Neil Carman, published a study (2001) that concluded growing children are more vulnerable to hydrogen sulphide because they breathe more rapidly, taking in significantly more pollution than adults. @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgency @StinkStopthe over 30 mins at 5 ppb INDOORS.

@ClareDinnisEA @JamesBevanEA @EnvAgencyMids @EnvAgency Here we go again. Hydrogen Sulphide seeping into the house. What are you actually going to do about it? All talk no action. @BBCPanorama @C4Dispatches @BorisJohnson @MattHancock #StopTheStink #LandfillStillStinks
